sub_title: Emeritus Professor, Past President, Consultant and Interim Manager
summary:
Prof. dr. A.W.C.A. Cornelissen is presently active as consultant and interim manager. He was from April 1, 2009 until September 1, 2016 President of the Board of Windesheim, University of Applied Sciences. Windesheim (2016) offers a total of 82 Associate, Bachelor and Master degrees, with 21,607 students and a staff of 2,264 (1,641 fte). These degrees cover four divisions: Human Movement and Education; Business, Media and Law; Health Care and Social Work; Engineering and ICT. Windesheim was ranked in 2015 as the number 1 among the large Universities of Applied Sciences by Elsevier [nr 39; September 24, 2015]; 38 bachelor programmes obtained a national top-3 position.

His academic education was a master in Biology (University of Amsterdam) and a PhD in parasitology (Utrecht University). He worked as a researcher at Utrecht University, the University of Edinburgh, the Netherlands Cancer Institute and as group-leader at the Max-Planck-Institute for Biology. In 1991, he was appointed as full professor in parasitology by Utrecht University. He published more than 55 international publications in ‘refereed’ journals (H-index: 34) and succesfully supervised 26 PhD students. He became dean of the Faculty of Veterinary Medicine in 1999 and fulfilled this position until 2009. The faculty was under his deanship ranked among the top five of the world for its educational- and reseach performance and number one within Europe. 

He was/is member of  (inter)national committees, science foundations, professional societies, non-governmental organisations, the Netherlands Organisation for Scientific Research and the Netherlands Association of Universities of Applied Sciences. 

Recipient of: a fellowship of the Royal Society of Great Britain [1982]; Erna and Victor Hasselblad Foundation Award [1987]; Sir Arnold Theiler Award [2007]; Honorary distinction Katsetsart University [2008]; Honorary Member of the Veterinary Student Association [2008]; Knighted, Officer in the Order of Orange Nassau [2009]; the Harrier (Kiekendief) Flevoland [2016].

profile_positions.description: Nieuw Unicum offers professional care to persons with a physical handicap. New Unicum is certified as treatment and care center for Multiple Sclerosis as well as a center of expertise for acquired brain injury. Nieuw Unicum provides nursing and care, (para) medical treatment, (neuro) psychological and psychosocial counseling, support facilities, day care, housing and home care. New Unicum employs a staff of 453 (313 fte). These employees offer, along with about 90 volunteers,  support to  246 clients. In total there are 248 places available for care stay. Operating revenue was 24,4 million €  (annual report 2015).
profile_positions.title: Chairman of the Supervisory Board

profile_positions.description:
The university (2016) offers 82 associate, bachelor and master degrees grouped in four divisions:   Human Movement and Education; Business, Media and Law; Health Care and Social Work; Engineering and ICT. There are 21,607 students and a 2,264 staff members (1,641 fte). Operating revenue was 185 m€.

Windesheim is participant in four national Centres of Expertise, namely: iLab Green PAC (Polymer Application Centre); CoE Logistics The Netherlands; TechForFuture (High Tech Systems and Materials) and TechYourFuture (Education). These centres are accredited by the Ministry of Education, Culture and Science. iLab Green Pac was, out of 260 nominees, awarded the Grand Jury Prize by the European Entrepreneurship Promotion Awards of the European Commission [EEPA, 2019].

Windesheim was ranked in 2015 as the national number 1 among the large Universities of Applied Sciences by Elsevier (nr 39; September 24, 2015); 60 percent of the bachelor programmes obtained a national top-3 position. In 2016 Windesheim ranked in the top-3 of Elsevier and the national Higher Education Selection Guide (Keuzegids Hoger Onderwijs).

Windesheim graduates earn on average a high income and belong national to the top-3 within ten years after graduation (SEO Economic Research/Elsevier; June 2017).

profile_positions.description: InnoComm Foundation is a not-for-profit organization which focuses on serving commercial organizations, government bodies, and education when recruiting and selecting (temporary) workers with specific professional knowledge. Candidates are supervised with InnoComm’s mentor program Seniors4Talents. The Foundation goals are to stimulate social participation and also to offer a chance to disadvantaged candidates to find employment or allow them to participate via an alternative route, for example through education. InnoComm Foundation provides an extensive network that offers many possibilities to be able to invest in social participation, social return, social value and sustainable employment.

profile_positions.description:
The faculty (2008) employs a staff of approximately 1000 persons (840 fte). There are 1500 students within the veterinary curriculum. A total of 200 PhD students are registered. We treat more than 24.000 patients per year. The annual turn over is 73 million €.
The faculty is on basis of international accreditation rated as being among the top five veterinary institutions in the world. This assessment was made on the basis of objective data and subjective impressions and reflections. Bibliometric assessment supports this judgement.The faculty is widely perceived as one of the leading veterinary institutions in the world not only for research but also in teaching, postgraduate training, veterinary specialisation and patient care.
